fields.description:
On a 3.3.0 install where the SC is on a separate machine from the CLC on an LDAP/AD integrated cloud, when the SC is stopped, then started - upon startup it initiates an LDAP sync.  This can be seen in the cloud-output.log:

{code}
8] Registering listener: DNSControlInternal on endpointUri: http://127.0.0.1:8773/internal/DnsInternal
Tue Jul 30 12:22:39 2013 DEBUG [NioMessageReceiver:Thread-7] [org.mule.transport.AbstractMessageReceiver.connect(AbstractMessageReceiver.java):424] Connecting: NioMessageReceiver{this=18617f2f, receiverKey=http://127.0.0.1:8773/internal/DnsInternal, endpoint=http://127.0.0.1:8773/internal/DnsInternal}
Tue Jul 30 12:22:39 2013  INFO [NioMessageReceiver:Thread-7] [org.mule.transport.AbstractMessageReceiver.connect(AbstractMessageReceiver.java):429] Connected: NioMessageReceiver{this=18617f2f, receiverKey=http://127.0.0.1:8773/internal/DnsInternal, endpoint=http://127.0.0.1:8773/internal/DnsInternal}
Tue Jul 30 12:22:39 2013  INFO [NioHttpConnector:Thread-7] [org.mule.transport.AbstractConnector.registerListener(AbstractConnector.java):1008] Registering listener: StorageInternal on endpointUri: http://127.0.0.1:8773/internal/StorageInternal
Tue Jul 30 12:22:39 2013 DEBUG [NioMessageReceiver:Thread-7] [org.mule.transport.AbstractMessageReceiver.connect(AbstractMessageReceiver.java):424] Connecting: NioMessageReceiver{this=2c8d2970, receiverKey=http://127.0.0.1:8773/internal/StorageInternal, endpoint=http://127.0.0.1:8773/internal/StorageInternal}

fields.summary: Remote SC initiates LDAP Sync Upon Start Up
fields.environment:
*non-HA*

* 1 x CLC, Walrus
* 1 x CC, SC
* 1 x NC

comments.body:
To reproduce, do the following:

* Set up SC on a remote machine
* Set up LDAP/AD integration via cloud properties
* Stop/Start eucalyptus-cloud process on SC
* observe cloud-output.log on SC
Added link to sosreport for SC.
LDAP identity synchronization is now only performed by the coordinator, not other hosts.

Fix Verified

LDAP identity synchronization is now only performed by the coordinator.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 3.4.0
Release     : 0.0.1628.20131012git43ee8e45.el6

Reopening this issue because I saw this in my 3.4 multi-cluster cloud when I started the storage controller that was on a remote machine.

{code}
# grep -i ldap /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log | head -20
Mon Nov 4 04:48:58 2013  INFO [ComponentDiscovery:main] [com.eucalyptus.records.BaseRecord.info(BaseRecord.java):167] :1383569338995:ComponentDiscovery:bootstrap:BOOTSTRAP_INIT_COMPONENT:class com.eucalyptus.component.id.Ldap
Mon Nov 4 04:48:58 2013 DEBUG [ComponentIds:main] [com.eucalyptus.component.ComponentIds.lookup(ComponentIds.java):93] Registered ComponentId: class com.eucalyptus.component.id.Ldap
Mon Nov 4 04:48:59 2013  INFO [PropertiesDiscovery:main] [com.eucalyptus.configurable.PropertiesDiscovery.processClass(PropertiesDiscovery.java):93] --> Registered property: authentication.ldap_integration_configuration
Mon Nov 4 04:49:04 2013  INFO [Bootstrap:main] [com.eucalyptus.records.BaseRecord.info(BaseRecord.java):167] :1383569344281:Bootstrap:bootstrap:COMPONENT_REGISTERED:Component ldap=available service=not-local

enabled services: [arn:euca:eucalyptus::jetty:10.104.10.22/eucalyptus/jetty jetty:unpartitioned:cloudLocal:, arn:euca:eucalyptus::notifications:10.104.10.22/eucalyptus/notifications storage:partitioned:cloudLocal:, arn:euca:eucalyptus::ldap:10.104.10.22/eucalyptus/ldap ldap:unpartitioned:cloudLocal:, arn:euca:bootstrap:cluster:gatherlog:10.104.10.22/cluster/gatherlog gatherlog:unpartitioned:, arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:10.104.10.22/eucalyptus/dns dns:unpartitioned:cloudLocal:, arn:euca:eucalyptus::tokens:10.104.10.22/eucalyptus/tokens tokens:unpartitioned:cloudLocal:, arn:euca:bootstrap::component:10.104.10.22/bootstrap/component component:unpartitioned:alwaysLocal:, arn:euca:bootstrap:cluster:node:10.104.10.22/cluster/node arn:euca:eucalyptus:loadbalancing:loadbalancing:10.104.10.22/loadbalancing/loadbalancing loadbalancing:unpartitioned:cloudLocal:, arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:10.104.10.22/walrus/walrus configuration:unpartitioned:cloudLocal:, arn:euca:eucalyptus::euare:10.104.10.22/eucalyptus/euare euare:unpartitioned:cloudLocal:, arn:euca:eucalyptus::cluster:10.104.10.22/eucalyptus/cluster cluster:partitioned:cloudLocal:]
Mon Nov 4 04:51:33 2013  INFO [ServiceContextManager:Thread-7] [com.eucalyptus.context.ServiceContextManager.createContext(ServiceContextManager.java):226] -> Rendering configuration for ldap

  "ldap-service":{
    "server-url":"ldap://10.111.5.39:389",

ldap-service:

Mon Nov 4 04:51:35 2013 DEBUG [Threads:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:DeferredPropertiesBootstrapper.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#44] [com.eucalyptus.system.Threads.newThread(Threads.java):178] CREATE new thread named: LDAP sync using: class com.eucalyptus.auth.ldap.LdapSync$1
Mon Nov 4 04:51:35 2013 DEBUG [LdapSync:LDAP sync] [com.eucalyptus.auth.ldap.LdapSync$1.run(LdapSync.java):267] Sync started
...
# grep -i ldap /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log | wc -l
555
{code}

My cloud setup is as follows:

*non-HA*
** 1 x CLC/Walrus
** 2 x CC/SC (one CC/SC for each cluster)
** 2 x NCs (one NC per cluster)

Version of Eucalyptus:

{code}
# rpm -qa | grep euca
eucalyptus-3.4.0-0.0.1592.20131004git8aa607bc.el6.x86_64
python-eucadmin-3.4.0-0.0.1592.20131004git8aa607bc.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-sc-3.4.0-0.0.1592.20131004git8aa607bc.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-gl-3.4.0-0.0.1592.20131004git8aa607bc.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-admin-tools-3.4.0-0.0.1592.20131004git8aa607bc.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-common-java-libs-3.4.0-0.0.1592.20131004git8aa607bc.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-enterprise-storage-san-equallogic-libs-3.4.0-0.0.1525.20131003git8600d52c.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-enterprise-storage-san-equallogic-3.4.0-0.0.1525.20131003git8600d52c.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-sos-plugins-0.1.3-1.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-common-java-3.4.0-0.0.1592.20131004git8aa607bc.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-cc-3.4.0-0.0.1592.20131004git8aa607bc.el6.x86_64
{code}

My cloud setup (currently I only have one cluster running since I was in the process of restarting the entire cloud).  The logs were seen on the ENABLED SC:

{code}
# euca-describe-services
SERVICE	autoscaling    	autoscaling    	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/AutoScaling	arn:euca:eucalyptus:autoscaling:autoscaling:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	jetty          	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Jetty  	arn:euca:eucalyptus::jetty:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	euare          	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Euare  	arn:euca:eucalyptus::euare:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	bootstrap      	bootstrap      	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Empyrean	arn:euca:bootstrap:::10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	cluster        	Exodus         	NaturalMystic  	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.22:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:Exodus:cluster:NaturalMystic/
SERVICE	cluster        	Legend         	IsThisLove     	NOTREADY  	30  	http://10.104.1.185:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:Legend:cluster:IsThisLove/
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	StirItUp       	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Walrus 	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:StirItUp/
SERVICE	loadbalancing  	loadbalancing  	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/LoadBalancing	arn:euca:eucalyptus:loadbalancing:loadbalancing:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	cloudwatch     	cloudwatch     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/CloudWatch	arn:euca:eucalyptus:cloudwatch:cloudwatch:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	reporting      	bootstrap      	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Reporting	arn:euca:bootstrap::reporting:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	tokens         	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Tokens 	arn:euca:eucalyptus::tokens:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Dns    	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:10.104.10.6/
SERVICE	storage        	Exodus         	TheHeathen     	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.22:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:Exodus:storage:TheHeathen/
SERVICE	storage        	Legend         	NoWomanNoCry   	BROKEN    	30  	http://10.104.1.185:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:Legend:storage:NoWomanNoCry/
SERVICE	notifications  	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Notifications	arn:euca:eucalyptus::notifications:10.104.10.6/
{code}
Periodic synchronization only occurs on the coordinator (as per fix in 3.4.0), but the synchronization on start up was not addressed (we should also check synchronization on license change)

[~tony], 

Have we ran the fix through QA yet?  Just confirming because I ran into it on my 3.4.1 cloud.

_cloud-debug.log sample from the SC_
{code}
....
Thu Jan 16 10:06:11 2014 DEBUG [LdapSync:LDAP sync] [com.eucalyptus.auth.ldap.LdapSync.updateAccount(LdapSync.java):413] Updating account account10
Thu Jan 16 10:06:11 2014 DEBUG [LdapSync:LDAP sync] [com.eucalyptus.auth.ldap.LdapSync.updateUser(LdapSync.java):553] Updating user user91 in account account10

.....
{code}

_Eucalyptus Version_
{code}
# rpm -qa | grep euca
python-eucadmin-3.4.1-0.0.445.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-sc-3.4.1-0.0.445.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-gl-3.4.1-0.0.445.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-admin-tools-3.4.1-0.0.445.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-common-java-3.4.1-0.0.445.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-cc-3.4.1-0.0.445.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-3.4.1-0.0.445.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-common-java-libs-3.4.1-0.0.445.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-sos-plugins-0.1.4-0.el6.noarch
{code}

[~tony],

Sorry about that, should have been clearer as to when I saw the issue.  I am referencing the syncing only on startup.  

Hope that helps.  Let me know if you have any additional questions.
In 4.0 it is likely that this issue will impact all hosts running user facing services.

This issue was previously scheduled to be worked on in more than one sprint:
* '3.3 Sprint 4' (on board 'Test 3.3 Board')
* '3.3 Sprint 4' (on board 'Copy of 3.3 Release Board')
